FINAL PROJECT SHOWCASE

Students were instructed to submit a final project at the end of the course. It could be a completed assigned project, or a totally new creation of their own. Mentors provided comments for each submission for improvement, but was overall surprised with the effort that students put into their projects despite the challenges that COVID-19 brought this semester. Great job, young coders!

FEATURED PROJECTS

We thought that several projects went beyond our expectations due to originality and creativity, thoughtfulness, and overall effort and time spent on the project. Check out their final projects by clicking on the images!

Emie's Interactive Solar System

Class: Intro to Web Dev (Spring 2024)

Do you want explore our solar system and learn about each planet? Then check out Emi's fun interactive website were you'll learn loads fo fun fact.

Kiyoshi's Snake Game

Class: Intro to Web Dev (Spring 2024)

Come play Kiyoshi remake of the classic snake game. See how long you can survive or challenge friends to see who can get the highest score!

Miku's Music Selector

Class: Intro to Web Dev (Spring 2024)

Getting board of hearing the same songs over and over again? Don't worry! You can discover new songs from other countries with Miku's Music Selector where you are sure to find your next new favorite.

Lauren's Interactive Storybook

Class: Intro to Web Dev (Spring 2022)

Do you want to learn more about ʻōlelo Hawaiʻi or the Hawaiian language? Take a look at Lauren's short storybook about a journey to the beach and explore the values of taking care of our people.

Ethan's Piano Player

Class: Intro to Web Dev (Spring 2022)

Looking for a way to express your musical interest without buying an instrument? Now you can with Ethan's Piano Player. This online piano player can play a note with a touch of a key and intertwining them could make a harmonic sound.

Jack's PvZ Almanac

Class: Intro to Web Dev (Spring 2022)

Watch out!! Waves of zombies are slowly approaching you, luckily Jack's Plants vs. Zombies almanac can help you. It provides some the best plants to help you defend and defeat the zombies!

SPRING 2021 FINAL PROJECTS

Check out these other projects! Great start and our mentors are looking forward to its continued development. We particularly enjoyed the creative touch that several students added to their projects.
